answers.comment: Security baselines and standards are maintained as Infrastructure-as-Code and/or as part of the operational documentation for each applicable component or service.

Infrastructure-as-Code is used to enforce compliant configuration and refresh it with each release. 

In addition, monitoring systems are in place for key controls, including:

Performance and Capacity Monitoring
Vulnerability Management
Application Monitoring
Audit Logging

Risk assessments are performed at least annually. 

As part of this process, threats and changes (environmental, regulatory, and technological) to service commitments are identified and the risks are formally assessed.

Elastic's Risk Management standard defines the process to identify and manage risk associated with Information Security and Data Governance.

A risk assessment is performed at least annually.

Management has established defined roles and responsibilities to oversee implementation of the information security policy. 

Elastic has an extensive security program led by Elastic's CISO who is responsible for the security efforts for the company and ensuring that all employees, including management, are aware of their and their teams' role in adequately securing customer information.

All employees are required to read and acknowledge acceptance of the Information Security policies, and those are made available to everybody in the company. Job descriptions are documented for employees supporting the management of Information Security at Elastic, including those who do not report directly into the Information Security team.

We are happy to share our current SOC 2 Type 2 report, which includes the CSA STAR CCM criteria.

The SOC2 contains a description of the Information Security Program policies, standards and other artefacts that were audited by an independent third party.

Elastic has formally adopted an Information Security Program, which is aligned with ISO 27001, NIST, PCI, HIPAA and other best practice frameworks. 

An Elastic Information Security Program Policy serves as the backbone for all information security policies, standards, and guidelines. All policies are reviewed annually and approved by our CISO.

As part of this, mitigation strategies are determined for the risks that have been identified including updating policies/procedures, to implement the risk mitigation strategy.
